snippet: The Supreme Court has reaffirmed its 2002 ban on executing intellectually disabled people. It should have stayed Robert Wayne Holsey’s death sentence.
abstract: Editorial laments that Robert Wayne Holsey, who had IQ of 70, was executed by state of Georgia after Supreme Court declined to stay his execution; maintains that court should have stayed his death sentence given that his trial lawyer Andy Prince was incompetent and in light of fact that court had reaffirmed in May its 2002 ban on executing intellectually disabled people.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court has reaffirmed its 2002 ban on executing intellectually disabled people. It should have stayed Robert Wayne Holsey’s death sentence.

headline.seo: Injustice in Robert Wayne Holsey’s Case
